query.description:
Supported filter parameters:
 - `barcode`
 - `collection`
 - `delivery_profile_id`
 - `exclude_composite`
 - `gift_card`
 - `inventory_quantity`
 - `location_id`
 - `managed`
 - `managed_by`
 - `product_id`
 - `product_status`
 - `product_type`
 - `publishable_status`
 - `published_status`
 - `sku`
 - `tag`
 - `tag_not`
 - `taxable`
 - `title`
 - `updated_at`
 - `vendor`

See the detailed [search syntax](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/search-syntax)
for more information about using filters.

savedSearchId.description:
The ID of an existing saved search.
The search’s query string is used as the query argument.
Refer to [SavedSearch](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/latest/objects/savedsearch).

page.description:
The page to retrieve. If the page number requested is higher than the available number of pages an empty array will be returned.
Constraints: The allowed range is minimum: 1, maximum: 2147483647
Default value: 1

perPage.description:
The number of reviews to retrieve per page.
Constraints: The allowed range is minimum: 1, maximum: 100
Default value: 20

productUrl.description: The url of the product. Optional only if sku is provided.

sku.description: The sku of the product. Optional only if productUrl is provided.

stars.description:
Filter reviews with a specific number of stars.
Constraints: Allowed values are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5

locale.description:
The language in which the attributes, if any, are returned
Default value: en-US

attributeIds.description: A comma-separated list of attribute ids

sku.description: The sku of the product. Optional only if productUrl is provided.

input.description:
The profiles that you would like to remove from the list. 

Example:

{
  "emails":["george.washington@klaviyo.com","abraham.lincoln@klaviyo.com"],
  "phone_numbers":["+13239169023"],
  "push_tokens":["03df25c845d460bcdad7802d2vf6fc1dfde97283bf75cc993eb6dca835ea2e2r"]
}
The fields used to create a cart.
The fields used to create a cart.
The fields used to create a cart.
The fields used to create a customer access token.
The fields used to create a new customer.

email.description: The email address of the customer to recover.

customerAccessToken.description: The access token used to identify the customer.
The access token used to identify the customer.

id.description: Specifies the customer address to update.

customerAccessToken.description: The access token used to identify the customer.
The access token used to identify the customer.

id.description: Specifies the customer address to update.

updateProduct.description:
Update Product. If the input has Shopify values and a Shopify ID, the Shopify product with that ID is updated.
If the input has Shopify values and no Shopify ID, a Shopify product is created.

createProduct.description: Create Product. If Shopify values are provided, a Shopify product is also created and the new product ID is saved.

updateCollection.description:
Update Collection. If the input has Shopify values and a Shopify ID, the Shopify collection with that ID is updated.
If the input has Shopify values and no Shopify ID, a Shopify collection is created.

createCollection.description: Create Collection. If Shopify values are provided, a Shopify collection is also created and the new collection ID is saved.

images.description: Images. JSON Encoded string [{"url": "https://www.example.com/images/image.png", status:"inactive"}]. Status is optional and defaults to "inactive".

multipassToken.description: A valid multipass token to be authenticated.

input.description: Provides updated fields for the customer.

Recharge_updateMyAddress.description: Update an address, modifying the address for all uses.

page.description:
The page to retrieve. If the page number requested is higher than the available number of pages an empty array will be returned.
Constraints: The allowed range is minimum: 1, maximum: 2147483647
Default value: 1

perPage.description:
The number of reviews to retrieve per page.
Constraints: The allowed range is minimum: 1, maximum: 100
Default value: 20

productUrl.description: The url of the product. Optional only if sku is provided.

stars.description:
Filter reviews with a specific number of stars.
Constraints: Allowed values are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5

locale.description:
The language in which the attributes, if any, are returned
Default value: en-US

attributeIds.description: A comma-separated list of attribute ids

schema.description:
The profiles that you would like to remove from the list. 

Example:

{
  "emails":["george.washington@klaviyo.com","abraham.lincoln@klaviyo.com"],
  "phone_numbers":["+13239169023"],
  "push_tokens":["03df25c845d460bcdad7802d2vf6fc1dfde97283bf75cc993eb6dca835ea2e2r"]
}
The profiles that you would like to add to the list. Each object in the array must have an `email` or `phone_number`. You can also provide additional properties as key-value pairs.

ShopifyStorefront_Product.name: ShopifyStorefront_Product
ShopifyStorefront_Product.title: ShopifyStorefront_Product
ShopifyStorefront_Product.description:
A product represents an individual item for sale in a Shopify store. Products are often physical, but they don't have to be.
For example, a digital download (such as a movie, music or ebook file) also qualifies as a product, as do services (such as equipment rental, work for hire, customization of another product or an extended warranty).

availableForSale.description: Indicates if at least one product variant is available for sale.

after.description: Returns the elements that come after the specified cursor.

last.description: Returns up to the last `n` elements from the list.

before.description: Returns the elements that come before the specified cursor.

reverse.description: Reverse the order of the underlying list.

collections.description: List of collections a product belongs to.

compareAtPriceRange.description: The compare at price of the product across all variants.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the product was created.

truncateAt.description: Truncates string after the given length.

description.description: Stripped description of the product, single line with HTML tags removed.

descriptionHtml.description: The description of the product, complete with HTML formatting.

featuredImage.description:
The featured image for the product.

This field is functionally equivalent to `images(first: 1)`.

handle.description:
A human-friendly unique string for the Product automatically generated from its title.
They are used by the Liquid templating language to refer to objects.

onlineStoreUrl.description: The URL used for viewing the resource on the shop's Online Store. Returns `null` if the resource is currently not published to the Online Store sales channel.

first.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

productType.description: A categorization that a product can be tagged with, commonly used for filtering and searching.

publishedAt.description: The date and time when the product was published to the channel.

requiresSellingPlan.description: Whether the product can only be purchased with a selling plan.

sellingPlanGroups.description: A list of a product's available selling plan groups. A selling plan group represents a selling method. For example, 'Subscribe and save' is a selling method where customers pay for goods or services per delivery. A selling plan group contains individual selling plans.

tags.description:
A comma separated list of tags that have been added to the product.
Additional access scope required for private apps: unauthenticated_read_product_tags.

totalInventory.description: The total quantity of inventory in stock for this Product.

updatedAt.description:
The date and time when the product was last modified.
A product's `updatedAt` value can change for different reasons. For example, if an order
is placed for a product that has inventory tracking set up, then the inventory adjustment
is counted as an update.

selectedOptions.description: The input fields used for a selected option.

variantBySelectedOptions.description:
Find a product’s variant based on its selected options.
This is useful for converting a user’s selection of product options into a single matching variant.
If there is not a variant for the selected options, `null` will be returned.
